model_input:
Your task is to choose the better response based on the below criterion.
You will be given a list of past memories, a current conversation between two individuals, and two options of next responses.

CRITERION:
Consistency - The response should not contain information that contradicts the past memory.

The output format should be as follows:
Explanation: (a brief explanation)
Choice: (answer with "1", "2", or "tie")

Now choose the response that has better Consistency given the past memories and current conversation.

PAST MEMORIES:
Speaker A works as a zookeeper and loves animals, especially white tigers.
Speaker B works part-time in an AC warehouse pulling parts.
Speaker B has two terrier dogs as pets.
Speaker A has a pet raccoon named Journey and a bearded dragon named Sid.
Speaker B enjoys going on cruises for fun.
Speaker A does not play music for the animals at the zoo to keep them calm.
Speaker A's pet raccoon enjoys eating pizza.
Speaker A works at a zoo and has tried playing music for the white tigers and home concerts for their pets.
Speaker B finds their job repetitive and hopes for a promotion to make it more interesting.
Speaker A has penguins at the zoo and enjoys working with animals, offering Speaker B a chance to help out.
Speaker B mentions using dish soap to get grease off hands and suggests vinegar for neutralizing odors.
Speaker A works at a zoo and is willing to help Speaker B get an entry-level position there.
Speaker B is looking for a new job and is excited about the opportunity at the zoo.
Speaker A mentions that entry-level positions at the zoo involve cleaning enclosures and feeding less dangerous animals but offer decent pay, training, benefits, and assistance with schooling.
Speaker B is grateful for the opportunity and is looking forward to playing music for the animals, starting with something safer than the white tiger.
Speaker A and Speaker B share a love for music and plan to have a house concert with their pets.
Speaker A mentions having dogs and Speaker B admires them for their peaceful nature.
Speaker A has a pet raccoon and has a friend who found baby raccoons.
Speaker B has elderly terriers and is planning to leave their part-time job for a break before starting a new one.
Speaker A has been working at their job for almost 10 years and has only taken 3 vacations.
Speaker B is interested in taking a Disney cruise and has been watching videos on YouTube about them.
Speaker A is not interested in going on a cruise and would prefer camping as a vacation.
Speaker A's friend found two baby raccoons in her yard, one of which was given to Speaker A to keep as a pet.
Speaker B asks Speaker A if they have had a pet raccoon before.

CURRENT CONVERSATION:
Speaker A: I went out and got a pizza, and when I got home Journey ate a whole piece by herself!
Speaker B: That's super unfortunate, How do you get Journey to not eat the food?
Speaker A: Journey can open the fridge, maybe I should put a lock on it. Do you have trouble with your dogs getting into food too?
Speaker B: Well fortunately they can't open the fridge just yet! But yea sometimes they manage to get into other stuff, especially when I leave it out! Does Sid try to get into food also?
Speaker A: Sid is far more well behaved then Journey when it comes to food out. The worst Sid can do is escape from his cage once in awhile. How are your dogs doing anyways?
Speaker B: They've been better as I left my previous job so I'm spending more time with them, how do you manage to work full time and still keep those animals happy?
Speaker A: I think working at the zoo so long has helped. Why did you leave your last job. Was that the one you were working in the warehouse? Sorry to hear about your dogs, it can be hard managing older animals.
Speaker B: Yea, that totally makes sense! I just wanted time off to spend with the dogs and look for a better job elsewhere, I'm hoping that I'll be able to get a job outside of a warehouse!
Speaker A: That is understandable. I didn't always think I would end up a zookeeper. Do you have anything in mind?
Speaker B: Well, I really enjoy animals so I might think of applying to work in a zoo aswell! Is it a super busy job?
Speaker A: That sounds like a great idea! You would be surprised how busy it can be. Not every job is high demanding and you don't have to work with all the animals either. Is there anything you don't like to do? 

RESPONSE 1
Speaker B:  It sounds like you have such a fulfilling job at the zoo! I can't wait to join you there and start working with the animals. I'm excited to see what kind of music they enjoy and maybe even have a pet concert with your white tigers one day! And you know, I think our dogs would love a playdate with Journey and Sid too. Let's plan something fun for them soon!
RESPONSE 2
Speaker B: I don't mind getting my hands dirty, so I'm open to any tasks at the zoo! What's the most challenging part of working there, in your opinion?

YOUR OUTPUT:
Explanation:
prediction:
Explanation: The past memories indicate that Speaker A mentioned that Speaker B was looking forward to playing music for the animals, but starting with something safer than the white tigers. Therefore, Response 1 is inconsistent because it mentions having a pet concert with the white tigers, which contradicts the past memory of avoiding them for music sessions. Response 2 does not contain any information that contradicts the past memories.

Choice: 2
